alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Chester; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:32AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Chester, York, Cherokee and northeastern Union Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 832 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles east of Gaffney to 3 miles northwest of York to 5 miles south of Rock Hill. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Gaffney, York, Newport, Lesslie, Blacksburg, Fort Lawn, Sharon, Hickory Grove and Mcconnells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
